intro: Sericolea pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved sericolea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its succulent nature makes it well adapted to dry conditions, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
